text: Bottle. Pours a hazy golden pale orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty woody grainy caramel aroma. Fruity malty woody caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty woody caramel finish.

330 ml bottle served in abbey glass. Pours amber-brown with beige medium head. Malt and rum in the nose. Ripe banana, whiskey, a bit tequila, vanilla, raisins, soft alcohol. Complex. Balanced taste, nice malty sweetness with crisp bitterness. Creamy texture. Soft carbonated, medium body. Nice!
Bottle light amber smooth light toasted malts light Burbon notes and smooth bodied.
330ml bottle thanks to rich pours golden topped with a white head. Nose is sweet toffee marshmallows and oak. Taste is more of the nice bourbon barrel vanilla kick of oat sweet malts.

330ml bottle. Pours with a clear dark amber color and a small off-white head. The nose is restrained as long as it is cold. Get him some time. Sweet nose, malty, vanilla, some wooden aroma, toffee, sloightly fruits. The taste is herbal-sweet, followed by some wooden and vanilla notes. Bittersweet finish, rather short.
Amber beer with medium head sweet malt. Taste, sweet malt, bourbon, some spices. A little more than okay,

Bottle 33cl. poured into a teku glass. Clear pale amber, mid-sized frothy off-white head, dissipates slowly, fair lacing; aroma malt, overripe fruit, toffee, wood, alcohol, vanilla; taste light heavy sweet and light bitter, malt, toffee, woody, bourbon, nutty notes; dry sweetbitter aftertaste, wood and vanilla notes, bourbon and spices in the finish; medium body, oily texture, average carbonation; interesting brew, tasty.

0,33l bottle at home from trade with Maracuja05, big thanks. BB 22.04.2018. copper clear color, medium big white head. smells of joghurt, spices, marzipan, some ripe fruits, some sweetness. ok smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of tobacco, sweetness, nutty, marzipan, light yoghurt, light berry notes, ripe fruits. finishes lightly alcoholic with notes of tobacco, marzipan and light berry notes. good one overall, taste is quite nice, smell is rather average though. overall drinkable.
01-04-17 // sampled at CRAFT Frankfurt 2017. Hazy golden beer. Light bourbon already in the nose. Taste is pretty light for a Bock, light malty, some spices, barrel, bourbon in the end.

Amber to orange colour and with of white head. Nose is rather small but caramel notes with oak notes. Clear taste of whiskey barrel and some bitter hops. Palate rather sweet but enda bitter. Nice brew.

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, caramel, and a bit of bourbon. The flavor is sweet with notes of caramel, alcohol, bourbon, and malt, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle at yespr.
Hazy orange colored with a medium sized off-white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel and spices.
Fruity flavor of caramel and spices.
Fruity finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - Orange coloured pour with a white head. Sweet malty and fruity, some notes of apricot, some caramel and toffee, some bourbon accents coming in into the close.
33 cl. bottle. A hazy dark golden coloured beer with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, fruit, ok, spice, yeast and a mild bourbon taste.
Keg at Red Hot. Pours deep orange, nose is caramel, cereal, light funk, bourbon, taste is sweet, juicy orange, wood.
Butelka 0,33l. Ładna piana. W aromacie mało co się dzieje, delikatnie słodowe i alkoholowe, trochę rumu. W smaku wodniste, puste, delikatnie alkoholowe. Bardzo słabe.
Tastes stronger than it is. Sweet and heavy beer, strong and complex bourbon and caramel notes. Really enjoyable.

330ml bottle. Clear goldem brown with one finger white head. Aroma is toffee and mixed booze, bourbon, tequila, rum and a touch of fresh citrus. Taste is smooth toffee, a hint of butterscotch (though not in a negative way), sharp tequila booziness, bourbon, vanilla, rum and a touch of citrus. Medium to filling mouthfeel, light carbonation and sweet spicy boozy aftertaste.

Bottle from a local REWE market!

Pours golden orange with a flat head. Aroma has lots of rum and some caramel. Taste is caramelly sweet with rum and bourbon, paired with a slight dry hop note. Lots of rum in the finish.
EU local swap, trade with McTapps, thanks! 0.33l bottle. Pours copper with small white head, looks good. Aroma is a bit sweet, vanilla and some wood. Taste has vanilla, light bourbon, easy finish.
0,33l Flasche. Orangenes Bier mit relativ wenig Schaum. Geruch nach Caramel und Holz, dies wird im Geschmack bestätigt, dazu kommen Aromen nach Fudge, Vanille und Bourbon. Gelungen!

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2017 Couleur orangée un peu trouble, légère mousse. Nez sur le fruits jaune et le fut de bourbon assez leger. Gout caramel blond, fut de chêne leger, note vanille assez douce et leger butterscotch Très basique pour une bière en fut de bourbon, en plus seulement 6.6c°. Pas désagréable quand même. 

getränkemarkt oberkirch

Bottle 33cl shared by Calisky. A clear copper beer, nose is on grain and marzipan touch. Aroma is on barley sugar, grain, wet paper touch, light yellow fruit, very common, lot of barley sugar, in the industrial way, common blond caramel, wet paper, boring.

Goudoranje kleur, kraag verdwijnt snel tot een randje. Ruikt niet sterk, wat zoet, mout. Smaak is ook zoet en niet erg uitgesproken. Vaag iets likeurigs, vanille, minimaal bitter. Goed te drinken maar nietszeggend.
Malzig-süßer Geruch dem eine dezente Rauchnote innewohnt. Antrunk süßmalzig. Weiter geht es mit malzigen einlagen und leicht rauchiger Holzfaßnote. Abgang Marzipan, Malz und Whisky. Gut.
Bottle from Lena - clear golden color with white head. Taste is vanilla, tequila, wood, rather sweet. All in all quite subtle.

Fläschle (333ml, many thanx to the Lake of Constance!):Golden to deep golden, a bit unclear, smaller off-white foamy layer; moderate sweet-bitter nose of pale malt, dried fruits and a quite distinctive, but really soft, background of vanilla and wood; moderate bitter-sweet flavour, medium bodied, neither soft nor tart; lingering sweet-bitter flavour, dried fruits detectable, but mainly -besides pale malt - wood and vanilla, some balancing hops in the aftertaste. Even though the combination of Whisky and beer is not my favourite, I did like this one...
At the Dancing Camel, Pours orange with a small head, aroma of honey, wood, wax, flavor of honey, wood, toffee, medium bodied

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks David Cohen. Hazy golden. Slightly weak aroma with malt, graininess, a bit of honey, a bit of vanilla, wood, caramel. Sweet flavor, a bit alcoholic, with malt, caramel, honey. Medium-bodied. Kinda one-dimensional.

From tap. Pours cloudy orange with a small off white head. Aroma is toasted malty and slight caramelish. Sweet, toasted and slight caramelish. Bitter and slight herbal. Toasted and dry malty. Bitter and herbal finish.

Clear amber, white head. 
Wood, Bourbon, caramel, Bock.
No bitterness, slightly sweet, caramel.
Quite OK.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2016 0.33l bottle from marktkauf/edeka. pours a slightly hazy deep amber with a dense steady white head. aroma of oak, toffee, oranges. flavour of oak, vanilla. oily mouthfeel. oak is rather outstanding, but still a nice one.

0.33 l bottle from Biermuda, best before February 2017. Clear, golden amber with a rather large, frothy, almost stable, off-white head. Sweetish, slightly fruity aroma of caramel, vanilla and citrus. Sweetish, slightly malty and quite fruity taste of caramel, bourbon, vanilla, some citrus and oak, followed by a short, slightly bitter, quite woody-dry finish. Medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Quite nice, but quite different to what I expected to be honest, way fruitier and less malty. The barrels dominate quite a bit, but in this case I like it since its not boozy or anything.
Shared bottle, many thanks to hauxe. Pours a clear pale amber with a light beige head. Aroma of bourbon, wood, and malt. Taste is bourbon, oak, malt, vanilla. Good.

Clear amber coloured beer with a big, creme-coloured, quite good lasting head. Aromas of faint citrus hops, mild whiskey, vanilla, coconut, malt, some fruitiness behind the dominant whiskey aroma. Down-watered bourbon and a good amount of coconut in taste, overall medium sweet, some light pepperiness in finish. Average carbonation, medium body, creamy, oily texture. Bit warming alcohol. Theres not much beer character left except in the palate.

Aus der Flasche getrunken (Händlerlieferung). Klares Altgold mit mächtiger Schaumkrone im Glas. In der Nase leicht säuerliche Fassaromen. Im Mund sehr mild und und weich. Wie Whisky mit sehr viel geschmolzenem Eis.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2016 So ein wundervoll rundes und ausgedehnt zartes Bockbier muss man erstmal brauen...können oder auch wollen. Wobei hier definitiv die Fasslagerungen zur vanilligen, manchmal gar malzsüßen oder auch holzherben Ausrichtung, beigetragen haben. Ja, ja. Sanft schmeichelend kommt die Infusion daher, gleitet holzig dahin, fängt sich und blendet sich lächelnd, geschmeidig getreidig, aus. Wow...0,33/Unter 3. Bottle aus einem Getränkemarkt in Bremen.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Slightly hazy orange golden with off white head. Light milky, bourbon, coconut, sweet malts, bitter herbs, pasteurized milk, light cardboard, mineral water, light toffee. Light sweet, medium woody bitterness and a sour touch. Medium bodied with dry tanninic feel.
Sampled from bottle at THT October. Hazy golden with white head. Very malty, coconut, pasteurized milk, bourbon. Mild sweet and light bitter. Medium body, low carbonation. Sweet finish.

33cl can shared at THT. 
Thin ring white head. Clear amber pour. Not bad.

Bottle picked up in London and shared at Leightons. As Welde Bourbon Barrel Bock, 6.6%. A top 50 heller bock at the time. Dark amber orange, lightly sparkling, translucent, foamy off-white head. Aroma is wafer, vanilla biscuits, some bourbon. Body is light, tingly carbonation, foamy. Taste is biscuity malt, touch washed out by carbonation, bourbon and vanilla. A decent beverage. Would probably improve if left until carbonation had subsided a touch. (3.4)

- klare orang-braune Farbe mit guter, schnell zerfallender Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach braunem Kandis, Vanille, Toffee, getrocknete Früchte, Bourbon,
 Vanille und Holz
- aber auch der Alkohol ist eine Idee zu stark erkennbar
- für ein Bock ist die Carbonisierung doch etwas stärker als andere, was aber
 nicht unangenehm wirkt
- der Antrunk erinnert sehr an in Alkohol getauchte, kandierte Früchte, vorzugs-
 weise Aprikosen
- die holzige Bourbonnote hält sich gut begleitend im Hintergrund
- im Mittelteil wird mir der Alkohol  nicht der Bourbon  dann doch einen Ticken
 zu aufdringlich
- im Abgang fehlt mir dann etwas die Vielschichtigkeit
- hier haben sich die beschriebenen Aromen einfach zu sehr vermischt
Fazit: Trinkbares fassgelagertes Bock

19th September 2016Leightons flat clearance. Thanks to Danny. Light haze on this gold beer, patchy pale cream colour head. Palate is smooth and semi dry with modest fine carbonation. Soft malts, mildly sweet, Modest generic fruits, a little citrus. Light smooth finish. Its fine but appears to have hardly touched the sides of the bourbon barrel!
20.10.2016 - Herbal smell (like Hildegards Andorntrank). Blackberry and notes of wood. Warming alcohol finish. Not what I expected

A bottle of a barrel-aged beer that is a Top 50 Heller Bock on ratebeer for 600 yen from Maruho? Hell yeah, sign me up! Served in a glass stein.

A beautiful amber orange with a dense thick beige head of foam. Its got rich bready, tangy grain, mild (peat?) smoke and oaky notes. Some vanilla but nothing that really screams bourbon to me in the nose. Medium bodied but quite dry, the bourbon shows up in the flavor along with honey tangy grains, a bit of boozy warmth and perhaps a touch of the peaty smoke. Im thinking the barrels were probably a scottish/irish peated whisker. Good bang for your buck and a happy find for me.

Clear, copper colored, small+ beige head. Aroma is of some caramel, toffee, strong oak and bourbon vanilla, light buttery notes. Taste is medium sweet malt and caramel, light sugar, again strong vanilla and oak, woody, medium- bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, oily. Could be more complex but good enough...
Aroma: lots of malt with some bourbon; Appearance: dark amber with gushing white head; Taste: more sweet than boozy, malty; okay; Palate: medium body with long, sweet finish; Overall: decent.

33cl bottle shared at Leightons garbage share. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. It pours a clean golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of caramel and vanilla. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, OK

Bottle shared at Leightons gaff , 19/09/2016. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. A clear reddy amber coloured pour a loose off white head. Aroma is sweet cola cubes, alcohol, toffee, dried fruits, spicy wood. Flavour is composed of semi sweet toffee, biscuity malts, grassy, faint vanilla, bourbon barrel, woody tannin, Palate is medium sweet, moderate carbonation, semi drying finish. . Decent.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Danny. Pours clear orange with a creamy topping. Buttery toffee in the nose, some ripe citrus. Medium sweet flavour with light alcohol, ripe orange, bready malts, meringue. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Sweet finish, lightly warming, with ripe citrus, dough, white bread. Good stuff.

Bottle care of Danny. It pours clear rich amber with a medium off-white head. The aroma is sweet, sticky, sugary, candied fruits, candied apricot, peachy and bread. The taste is sweet, slick, sugary, dried fruits, dried apricot, mango, brown bread, toasty sugar and candy with a flat, sweet finish. Medium body and fine, foamy carbonation. A bit freakin sweet and malty. Ok for style.

Bottle split at Bespin, thanks to Dirty Danny, 19/09/16.
Clear golden amber with a decent off white head.
Nose is on the thin side, caramel ,straw, grains, light spice, trickle of bourbon.
Taste comprises caramel, papery strains, light bourbon, brown sugar, fruit esters, vanilla, caramel, tea leaves.
Medium bodied with bite, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Ok for style but the BA effect doesnt do much for me.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: AUG 29, 2016 Ambrata limpida, schiuma biancastra compatta. Al naso dolce di malto e caramello. Eccellente al palato con il malto in gran evidenza, dolcezza di vaniglia accompagnata dal liquore che si apprezza nel retrogusto. Carbonazione medio bassa. Corpo medio, leggera ma non esageratamente beverina.

Bottle from somewhere in Germany consumed at home Sunday 21st August 2016 whilst cooking Zarzuela (Spanish Fish Stew) and making Raspberry Ice Cream .   Pours hazy amber with a white rim, wow lots of coconut on the nose and also coming through in the mouth, smooth, soft in the mouth, sweet but with some vanilla. This is fine the barrel ageing add a nice softness but it tastes much stronger than it is (not boozy though) A7 A4 T7 P3 OV13 3.4

Bottle
Aroma-woody, fruits, honey
Appearance-amber, clear, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good
Bottle. Aroma is vanilla, wood and some malt. Taste is heavy vanilla with wood, caramel and malt. A interesting and very different beer.
Deep gold pour, small white head. Tart apple aroma. Flavor is quite tart, fruity, woody, boozy. Surprising, didnt expect this!

330ml bottle [Thanks to barrelbier for the Bourbon Bartle Bock and the entire mini-series!]. Barely clear, orangey deep golden to amber colour with average to huge, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Sweet-ish, pale malty aroma with a honey touch, background-ish hints of bourbon, vanilla, oak. Taste is slightly dry woody, oaky, pale malty, cautious hints of bourbon and vanilla. Relatively light and drinkable, more complementary than overpowered hints of "BA"; nevertheless quite simple and monotonous due to the rather characterless primary material.

Bottle. Orange color with white head. Aroma is wood sugar, oxidized, molasses. Taste is sugary, oxidized, the base beer gets lost. Quite chewy, though. Medium carbonation. Not bad per se, but a bit too much barrel for the base beer.
Bottle. Bourbon notes, oxidized, artificial vanilla. Amber, offwhite head. Overwrought barrel, too strong for the base beer. Spicy, chewy finish. Wasnt too impressed.
Leicht bräunliches goldgelb schöner schaum, Geruch Vanille fass ganz leicht whiskey, Geschmack Geschmack holzig leichte Vanille süsslich leichte fruchtige säure, langer herber Abgang

Bottled 330ml. -Courtesy of and shared with Domagoj, thanks! Darker golden coloured, small off-white head, mild wood in the nose. Sweet malty, pretty strong bourbon, wood, light caramel and vanilla but unfortunately too light overall. Must be better, so far unfortunately average.
330ml Flasche. Opalisierend und bernsteinfarben. Kleine Schaumkrone. Aroma von Karamell und Vanille. Süß im Antrunk, mild und weich ausklingend. Voller Körper.
caramel, resin, woody, red, clear, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, lively, long finish,

0,33 l bottle as a gift 
alcohol, vanilla, woody, caramel, dark golden - light amber color, clear and without foam head. medium - heavy sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, oily feel, flat, long finish,

Bottle from bartlebier. Many thanks. Clear dark golden colour, white head. Very complex aroma, coconut, rum, wood, malt, caramel. Taste is wood, rum, bourbon, malty, coconut. Some alcohol, but very noble. Balanced, complex beer. Some bitterness in aftertaste. This is very good.

Bottle shared at tasting. Complex aroma of coconut and various notes of barrels. Dried fruits, sherry, vanilla, rumy. Clear golden to amber colour. Taste is well balanced yet very complex. Coconut, dried fruits, caramel, woody. Lightly warming finish. Carbonation is moderate, drinkability almost moderate. Intense and flavourful.
Bottle kindly shared by rusos, many thanks. Amber golden color with medium white head sweet malt, bourbon, honey in aroma. Taste, sweet malt, oranges, bourbon, coconut, some spices. Very good.

Bottle at 100piv tasting 03/2016, shared by rusos, thanks. Pours amber color, white small head. Aroma of bourbon, caramel, honey. Taste is sweet, lightly bitter, coconut, honey, bourbon, vanilla, woody, some alcohol.

Flasche 0,33l: Orange, Bernstein, leichte Trübung, wenig mittelporiger Schaum; in der Nase kräftige Würze, kräftige Süße, leichte Hefearomen, Cremigkeit, Bananenmilchshake, Ananas; im Körper kräftige Süße, kräftige süße Würze, malzig, sehr cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, sahnig, exotische Früchte, etwas Ananas, Papaya, leichte Holznote; angenehmer schwer würzig-süßer Nachgang
Bottle, 33cl. German tasting. Pours golden / light orange. Malty nose, some wood. Fine aroma, not alcoholic. Dusty barrel notes. Balanced, tasteful.

Bottle with two labels with enough informations about drinktemperature, hop, IBU and so on. No details about the malts.
Amber clear beer with a small creamy off-white head, I can smell the barrel, woody, light sour, not sweet, the finish is the barrel, drink not too cold this beer,
(I have a 0.33l bottle with best-before date 02.04., the rest I can not read.)

(bottle, 33cl, with thanks to Quack-Duck!) Slightly hazy, golden to light-amber colour with a firm and medium-sized, slightly off-white foamy head. Honey-ish and mildly biscuity malty aroma with oaky notes of vanilla, backed by some buttery and flowery accents. Moderately sweet flavour with a light level of bitterness, medium bodied with a modest carbonation. Slightly biscuity and malt character with present notes of vanilla, butterscotch and cocos; sweet and discreetly bitter finish with cocos and vanilla in the aftertaste; the alcohol is well-integrated. I liked it. 08.II.16

UPDATED: APR 13, 2017 Bottle at home. Pours hazy amber with big off-white head. Aroma of boiled vegetables, milk, caramel, coconut, oak, alcohol, some ripe fruit, vanilla, white wine. Taste sweet and dry with a lot of coconut-dominated oak. Some hoppy bitter finish.

0,33 l Flasche aus einem lokalen Rewe-Markt. Mandarinen- bis kupferfarbend, klar mit reichlich Kohlensäure und einer dicken cremigen Schaumkrone. In der Nase habe ich süße Noten, Karamell, Kandis. Im Geschmack kommt klar das Fass durch, man schmeckt den Bourbon. Im Abgang fein hopfig-bitter. Echt gelungen

Orange bis kupferfarben, ganz leicht getrübt mit weißem Schaum präsentiert sich dieses fassgelagerte Bockbier. In der Nase kündigt sich ein malzig karamelliges Bier an, die Fasslagerung ist schon erkennbar. Diese tritt dann beim Trinken spürbar in den Vordergrund. Die Lagerung in Bourbon-, Rum- und Tequilafässern bringen tolle Aromen zu Tage, die wunderbar mit dem süßen Malzkörper harmonieren: Eiche, Vanille, Karamell(-bonbon) , Toast, Kokos. Der Abgang wird von einer leichten Hopennote begleitet. 
Insgesamt erinnert das Bier an das Innis & Gunn Original. 

Empfehlung!

50 ml sample. Hazy amber. Aroma has caramel, vanilla, white pomace. Tastes moderately sweet, crystal malts, woody tannins, notes of vanilla and whisky. Smooth and complex - well done. (Backlog 17-JAN-2016).

Look: hazy amber.

Aroma: barrels, oak.
Taste: sweet with tannins.
Flavour: oak, vanilla, whiskey, some wine notes.
Some hops in the aftertaste.

Good with prominent barrel notes.

0,33l bottle. Pours deep amber with thin white head. Nose is country wine cellar: wine, oak, some salt, bourbon, warm alcohol. Medium body. Taste is dry with pronounced oak overtones and crisp slightly hoppy finish. More like a good strong pills with some barrel nuances than a traditional bock. Still a good beer though.

Pours amber and somewhat flat looking into the glass. Very little head. Aroma is of oak and bourbon, but with an apple cider fruitiness. Taste is buttery, with noticeable strands of vanilla and rum, and just a hint of smokiness underlying it all. Carbonation is soft. Body is medium, slightly viscuous, and each sip ends with a warm, long, and lightly bitter finish. Intriguing. This has a very high drinkability ... wish I had another bottle of this. A very good bock.

A malty smell, sweet and fruity, with some rum and coke. The head is small, white and milky with a normal duration. The body is dark red. A strange taste with cocos and malt. The head is medium strong, light creamy with a flat carbonation.

Bottle. Clear red golden color, small fine head. Nose is dominant Bourbon, vanilla, sweet wood. Decent dry taste, light bitter. Light texture, low carbonation. Reminds of scotch which aged on Bourbon casks, typical sweet vanilla and spices. Very nice, enjoyed this one very much.
330ml bottle at home in Gerlingen. Aroma is malt, rum, brown sugar. Appearance is clear golden with a frothy head. Taste is light sweet, bourbon-ish. Soft carbonation. Very well balanced Bock.
0,33l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours deep clear golden with a medium head. Aroma is sweet malts, whisky and alcohol. Flavor is sweet malts, alcohol, some fruits and a slightly hoppy finish. Good.
Bottle, 33 cl, bought by my wife in Heidelberg. Decent, overall feature in aroma is vanilla. Small finish.
bottle, Heinrichs 3000 Kornwestheim. Amber brown with a beige head. Full-bodied, malty with some dark malts and lots of vanilla flavours, also shy hints of rum and wood.

Aroma: malty, vanilla, woody.
Appearance: clear amber color and white head.
Taste: vanilla, woody, whisky, malty, roasted malts, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, woody finish.
Overall: Amazingly good beer, really drinkable and complex bock.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Welde Bourbon Barrel Bock ].[ Trade by Beerhunter111 ]. Clear medium orange color with a average to large, frothy - creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, caramel, sweet malt, wood - vanilla - bourbon. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, rum - sugar sweet, vanilla, malty, sweet malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20151024]

0,33l Flasche. Bernsteinfarbenes Bier. Vanille, karamell, Bourbon, Rumin der Nase. Klasse Duft. Runder weichet Bock. Im Geschmack Vanille, Whiskey, ein Hauch Himbeere und Johannisbeere. Sensationeller Bock!

Bottle from trade with Bartlebier, thanks! brown color. Caramel, bourbon and vanilla in the aroma. malty sweet flkavor, candy, caramel, hints of roast and a modest bourbon and vanilla character. Well rounded, quite sweet, a bit onedimensional but still a nice brew. Should have been barrel aged a bit longer.
Dark golden coloured and lightly hazy. Has a white head, medium duration. Aroma is sweet, light vanilla, light butter/diacetyl. Heavy sweet flavor, faint bitterness.
light rum aroma,amber, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bottle, 6.6%. Clear amber with medium creamy off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toasted, vanilla and oak. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, vanilla, sweet, oak, vanilla, hop and a little bitter.

Bottle @ Johns. Pours golden with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, wood, light vanilla, hint of butter, bourbon, light rum. Flavor is sweet, malt, wood, bourbon, rum, vanilla. Medium body, average carbonation, sweet finish. 241015
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are bourbon, vanilla, fruits, caramel, wood and hops. Very nice.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, light vanilla and bourbon. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. 241015

Nice crystal clear caramel color covered by a white head of medium stability.
Wooden aromas combined with bourbon notes, caramel and dried raisin, rhum.
The first sip is sweet and blasts of bourbon and rhum notes. The alcohol burn is overdefined in my eyes, too heavy for a 6.6 ABV beer. Didnt they empty the barrels before filling them with this Bock? Three months in bourbon, rum and tequila barrels sounds a lot, but it isnt. Seems that the aromas are somehow enhanced. There are a lot of barrel aged beers that stay longer in barrels but have a smoother, more subtle and harmonic taste picture.
Thats why the balance is not at a top level. Welde gives an optimal drinking temperature of 12°C and its true that at this temp the different aromas and flavors combine the best.
The body is full and the finish is warm, lasting and full of dried fruit sweetness.

0,33 l bottle, bought at a local bottle shop. Nearly clear copper in the glass, small head. Whiskey with sourness on the nose. Starts a little bit boozy, then more malty parts with barrel background. Middle part with some sweetness. Also some bitter hop parts in the finish. Expected a little bit more complex and oily stuff. But not bad at all.

Bottle. Dark amber body with white head. Aroma is malts with some caramel and hints of bourbon. Taste is malty caramel with hints of biscuits. Aftertaste is malty sweetness with low bitterness. Missing the bourbon and barrel ageing.

Bottle many thc Frau McTapps cons 2015-09-12 Göteborg
Never had a BB Bock before ;)
AR: vanilla bourbon, sweet sugar cake
AP: hazy yellowish amber, thick cream brulee colored lid
F: vanilla bourbon, sugar cake, sweet mouthfeel, rich wee bubbly carbonation, medium bitterness, long and lasting feeling, caribbean fruitiness

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2015 33cl, Welde sampler Maruhn. Upfront perfumy barrel wafts, mild yet all honey and vanilla, like impregnated wood for interior design use. Instead of a yeast complexity, there is an architecture of a lean, sweetish Heller Bock providing the base on which some vanilla and mild rum perfumes perch, whilst the tequila seems to thin out the mouthfeel to provide a higher drinkability, yet also produces some gin-jenever notes that donot find a home in the Bocks flavour profile. Quite some rummed butterscotch and even real cream butter in mouthfeel, odd. Really missing depth of flavours here, as in the other two Welde craft experiments.
Minimal trübes dunkles Bernstein mit wenig Schaum. Sehr weich, etwas Holz, Bourbon, Karamell. Hopfen: Green Bullet.

Na, so ein Bock kann auch mir gut gefallen. Schoen suess und voller Karamell bereits in der Nase. Kekse kommen zum Vorschein als auch ein wenig Rum und diese kleinen Amarettini. Im Grunde ein Dessertpiwo. Top.

Thanks for sharing, Erzengel. The beer has got a light hazy golden-amber colour with a small head and smooth body. Aroma of oak, mild hops and mild bourbon. Taste of sweet bourbon whiskey, mild barrells, mild hops, malt, vanilla and mild fruits. Highly delicious and quaffable. Loved it.
Neutral-süßlicher Geruch. Mild-weicher Antrunk. Schönes weiches Holzfass. Milde Vanille, weich, aber nicht zu tief. Das Holz ist toll-weich. Karamell, Vanille. Mild-weicher Nachgeschmack. Spannend.

Deep amber, clear, with one-finger white head. Sweet buttery aroma. Taste is strongly malty, plenty of vanilla and butter. Too sweet for me, but that might be the style. Also not sure if the butter is coming from the barrel or the fermentation.
Braukunst Live München 2015. Pours a dark yellow color head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are bourbon, vanilla.
Fast klare dunkel goldene Farbe, geringe weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht holzig, kräftig malzig, Bourbon. Geschmack mild holzig, Vanille, Karamell.
Runder, hell malziger Antrunk, vollmundig. Milde Bourbonnoten im Hintergrund, minimal Tequila. Leicht fruchtiger Nachhall, rund. 12/11/11/12//12
